class.name: Phaser.Rectangle

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the Rectangle.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the Rectangle.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the Rectangle. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the Rectangle. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

class.help: Creates a new Rectangle object with the top-left corner specified by the x and y parameters and with the specified width and height parameters.\nIf you call this function without parameters, a Rectangle with x, y, width, and height properties set to 0 is created.

public.name: aabb

returns.help: The new Rectangle object.

public.help: Calculates the Axis Aligned Bounding Box (or aabb) from an array of points.

parameters.name: points
parameters.help: The array of one or more points.

parameters.name: out
parameters.help: Optional Rectangle to store the value in, if not supplied a new Rectangle object will be created.

public.name: centerOn

returns.help: This Rectangle object

public.help: Centers this Rectangle so that the center coordinates match the given x and y values.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate to place the center of the Rectangle at.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate to place the center of the Rectangle at.

public.name: clone
public.help: Returns a new Rectangle object with the same values for the x, y, width, and height properties as the original Rectangle object.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Rectangle object.

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: Optional Rectangle object. If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Rectangle object will be created and returned.

public.name: contains

returns.help: A value of true if the Rectangle object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the specified coordinates are contained within the region defined by this Rectangle object.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Rectangle object.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the point to test.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the point to test.

public.name: containsPoint

returns.help: A value of true if the Rectangle object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the specified point is contained within the rectangular region defined by this Rectangle object. This method is similar to the Rectangle.contains() method, except that it takes a Point object as a parameter.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Rectangle object.

parameters.name: point
parameters.help: The point object being checked. Can be Point or any object with .x and .y values.

public.name: containsRaw

returns.help: A value of true if the Rectangle object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the specified coordinates are contained within the region defined by the given raw values.

parameters.name: rx
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the top left of the area.

parameters.name: ry
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the top left of the area.

parameters.name: rw
parameters.help: The width of the area.

parameters.name: rh
parameters.help: The height of the area.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the point to test.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the point to test.

public.name: containsRect

returns.help: A value of true if the Rectangle object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the first Rectangle object is fully contained within the second Rectangle object.\nA Rectangle object is said to contain another if the second Rectangle object falls entirely within the boundaries of the first.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Rectangle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Rectangle object.

public.name: copyFrom

returns.help: This Rectangle object.

public.help: Copies the x, y, width and height properties from any given object to this Rectangle.

parameters.name: source
parameters.help: The object to copy from.

public.name: copyTo

returns.help: This object.

public.help: Copies the x, y, width and height properties from this Rectangle to any given object.

parameters.name: source
parameters.help: The object to copy to.

public.name: equals

returns.help: A value of true if the two Rectangles have exactly the same values for the x, y, width and height properties; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the two Rectangles are equal.\nThis method compares the x, y, width and height properties of each Rectangle.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Rectangle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Rectangle object.

public.name: floor
public.help: Runs Math.floor() on both the x and y values of this Rectangle.

public.name: floorAll
public.help: Runs Math.floor() on the x, y, width and height values of this Rectangle.

public.name: inflate

returns.help: This Rectangle object.

public.help: Increases the size of the Rectangle object by the specified amounts. The center point of the Rectangle object stays the same, and its size increases to the left and right by the dx value, and to the top and the bottom by the dy value.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Rectangle object.

parameters.name: dx
parameters.help: The amount to be added to the left side of the Rectangle.

parameters.name: dy
parameters.help: The amount to be added to the bottom side of the Rectangle.

public.name: inflatePoint

returns.help: The Rectangle object.

public.help: Increases the size of the Rectangle object. This method is similar to the Rectangle.inflate() method except it takes a Point object as a parameter.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Rectangle object.

parameters.name: point
parameters.help: The x property of this Point object is used to increase the horizontal dimension of the Rectangle object. The y property is used to increase the vertical dimension of the Rectangle object.

public.name: intersection

returns.help: A Rectangle object that equals the area of intersection. If the Rectangles do not intersect, this method returns an empty Rectangle object; that is, a Rectangle with its x, y, width, and height properties set to 0.

public.help: If the Rectangle object specified in the toIntersect parameter intersects with this Rectangle object, returns the area of intersection as a Rectangle object. If the Rectangles do not intersect, this method returns an empty Rectangle object with its properties set to 0.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Rectangle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Rectangle object.

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: Optional Rectangle object. If given the intersection values will be set into this object, otherwise a brand new Rectangle object will be created and returned.

public.name: intersects

returns.help: A value of true if the specified object intersects with this Rectangle object; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the two Rectangles intersect with each other.\nThis method checks the x, y, width, and height properties of the Rectangles.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Rectangle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Rectangle object.

public.name: intersectsRaw

returns.help: A value of true if the specified object intersects with the Rectangle; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the object specified intersects (overlaps) with the given values.

parameters.name: left
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the left of the area.

parameters.name: right
parameters.help: The right coordinate of the area.

parameters.name: top
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the area.

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.help: The bottom coordinate of the area.

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.help: A tolerance value to allow for an intersection test with padding, default to 0

public.name: offset

returns.help: This Rectangle object.

public.help: Adjusts the location of the Rectangle object, as determined by its top-left corner, by the specified amounts.

parameters.name: dx
parameters.help: Moves the x value of the Rectangle object by this amount.

parameters.name: dy
parameters.help: Moves the y value of the Rectangle object by this amount.

public.name: offsetPoint

returns.help: This Rectangle object.

public.help: Adjusts the location of the Rectangle object using a Point object as a parameter. This method is similar to the Rectangle.offset() method, except that it takes a Point object as a parameter.

parameters.name: point
parameters.help: A Point object to use to offset this Rectangle object.

public.name: scale

returns.help: This Rectangle object

public.help: Scales the width and height of this Rectangle by the given amounts.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The amount to scale the width of the Rectangle by. A value of 0.5 would reduce by half, a value of 2 would double the width, etc.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The amount to scale the height of the Rectangle by. A value of 0.5 would reduce by half, a value of 2 would double the height, etc.

public.name: setTo

returns.help: This Rectangle object

public.help: Sets the members of Rectangle to the specified values.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the Rectangle.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the Rectangle.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the Rectangle. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the Rectangle. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

public.name: size

returns.help: The size of the Rectangle object

public.help: The size of the Rectangle object, expressed as a Point object with the values of the width and height properties.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Rectangle object.

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: Optional Point object. If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Point object will be created and returned.

public.name: toString

returns.help: A string representation of the instance.

public.help: Returns a string representation of this object.

public.name: union

returns.help: A Rectangle object that is the union of the two Rectangles.

public.help: Adds two Rectangles together to create a new Rectangle object, by filling in the horizontal and vertical space between the two Rectangles.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Rectangle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Rectangle object.

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: Optional Rectangle object. If given the new values will be set into this object, otherwise a brand new Rectangle object will be created and returned.

public.name: bottom
public.help: The sum of the y and height properties. Changing the bottom property of a Rectangle object has no effect on the x, y and width properties, but does change the height property.
public.inlineHelp: The sum of the y and height properties.

public.name: bottomRight
public.help: The location of the Rectangles bottom right corner as a Point object.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the location of the Rectangles bottom right corner as a Point object.

public.name: centerX
public.help: The x coordinate of the center of the Rectangle.
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of the center of the Rectangle.

public.name: centerY
public.help: The y coordinate of the center of the Rectangle.
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of the center of the Rectangle.

public.name: empty
public.help: Determines whether or not this Rectangle object is empty. A Rectangle object is empty if its width or height is less than or equal to 0.\nIf set to true then all of the Rectangle properties are set to 0.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the Rectangles empty state.

public.name: halfHeight
public.inlineHelp: Half of the height of the Rectangle.

public.name: halfWidth
public.inlineHelp: Half of the width of the Rectangle.

public.name: height
public.inlineHelp: The height of the Rectangle. This value should never be set to a negative.

public.name: left
public.help: The x coordinate of the left of the Rectangle. Changing the left property of a Rectangle object has no effect on the y and height properties. However it does affect the width property, whereas changing the x value does not affect the width property.
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of the left of the Rectangle.

public.name: perimeter
public.help: The perimeter size of the Rectangle. This is the sum of all 4 sides.
public.inlineHelp: The perimeter size of the Rectangle. This is the sum of all 4 sides.

public.name: randomX
public.help: A random value between the left and right values (inclusive) of the Rectangle.
public.inlineHelp: A random value between the left and right values (inclusive) of the Rectangle.

public.name: randomY
public.help: A random value between the top and bottom values (inclusive) of the Rectangle.
public.inlineHelp: A random value between the top and bottom values (inclusive) of the Rectangle.

public.name: right
public.help: The sum of the x and width properties. Changing the right property of a Rectangle object has no effect on the x, y and height properties, however it does affect the width property.
public.inlineHelp: The sum of the x and width properties.

public.name: top
public.help: The y coordinate of the top of the Rectangle. Changing the top property of a Rectangle object has no effect on the x and width properties.\nHowever it does affect the height property, whereas changing the y value does not affect the height property.
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of the top of the Rectangle.

public.name: topLeft
public.help: The location of the Rectangles top left corner as a Point object.
public.inlineHelp: The location of the Rectangles top left corner as a Point object.

public.name: topRight
public.help: The location of the Rectangles top right corner as a Point object.
public.inlineHelp: The location of the Rectangles top left corner as a Point object.

public.name: volume
public.help: The volume of the Rectangle derived from width * height.
public.inlineHelp: The volume of the Rectangle derived from width * height.

public.name: width
public.inlineHelp: The width of the Rectangle. This value should never be set to a negative.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the Rectangle.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the Rectangle.
